intro: Elatostema rubricaule, commonly known as the red-stemmed elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features slender, reddish stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and are typically greenish-white in color. Elatostema rubricaule is noted for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its role in local ecosystems as a food source for various insects and small animals.
